Title: Species of Rhytismatales on Berberis from China
Keywords: ITS rDNA, LSU rDNA, phylogeny, taxonomy
Abstract:
Three species of Rhytismatales on Berberis were found from
Sichuan and Yunnan Provinces in China. Two of them were described as new
species to science, namely Hypoderma minterii and Lophodermium
johnstonii. The third one was a known species, Hypoderma berberidis. The
phylogenetic relationships of these species within Rhytismatales were
analyzed based on partial large subunit nuclear ribosomal DNA and
internal transcriber spacer ribosomal DNA. The results showed that the
rhytismatalean species on Berberis, unlike most species on pines, were
not closely related. Three ITS sequences of Lirula macrospora in GenBank
were likely from misidentified sources. A key to species of
Rhytismatales on Berberis worldwide was also given.
